results.title: Self esteem
results.creator_credit: Robert Sande and Robert Sande Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”

Shows young people at a seminar discussing self-esteem including expectations of self, negative “self-talk” and child/parent relationships.

results.title: Putting yourself together
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Two teenagers and counsellor Daniel Whiteside take a close look at how to think your way past the put-downs or problems that often weaken your self-image. The give-and-take between the three, draws us into the film and challenges us all to start taking control of this part of our lives.

results.title: Kids, parents and pressures
results.creator_credit: Robert Sande, Bailey Film Productions and Robert Sande Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Teenagers attending a PACE Seminar identify some of the everyday pressures and tensions that confront them. With the help of highly qualified instructors, they learn they are in control of their own attitudes and work out positive and effective ways of improving their attitudes and relieving pressures.

results.title: Growth of London
results.creator_credit: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of the city’s growth from pre-Roman to modern times. The geology of the London basin and the potential importance of the site are considered. Shows the growth if London in Roman times and subsequent changes during Saxon, Mediaeval, Elizabethan, Restoration, Georgian, Victorian, and modern period. The later part of the film shows the rapid growth of the city in recent years and relates this to its geographical position and to the favourable position of the British Isles in a world altered by the Age of Discovery. And the Industrial Revolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Growth of infant behaviour: Later stages
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the increasing ability of the growing infant to use his hands in manipulating objects. Shows the definite and predictable stages by which the hand grows from an almost useless organ to the dextrous and sensitive instrument of the human will.
results.description: A demonstration of the increasing ability of the growing infant to use his hands in manipulating objects. Shows the definite and predictable stages by which the hand grows from an almost useless organ to the dextrous and sensitive instrument of the human will.

results.title: The Growth of flowers
results.brief_description: A series of time-lapse studies of roses, orchids, viruses, jack-in-pulpits, and daffodils, as their buds grow and swell and the flower opens out from the bud.

results.title: Growth of Cities
results.brief_description: A study of some of the factors, which determine the location and rate of expansion of cities, showing the general trend towards a centralization in USA. The factors involved in decentralization of cities, into metropolitan areas as applied to various types of cities, and various theories of city and town planning are presented.
